trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="app-service" ms.workload="web" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="02/23/2015" ms.author="stefsch"/>

trans-unit.source: Create multi-channel applications for the enterprise
trans-unit.target: Create multi-channel applications for the enterprise

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Enterprise multichannel apps present data to customers using multiple technologies.
trans-unit.target: Enterprise multichannel apps present data to customers using multiple technologies.

trans-unit.source: Enterprise web, mobile, and API consumers all retrieve and process information from a variety of sources.
trans-unit.target: Enterprise web, mobile, and API consumers all retrieve and process information from a variety of sources.

trans-unit.source: These sources span internal systems running on-premises as well as cloud-based services.
trans-unit.target: These sources span internal systems running on-premises as well as cloud-based services.

trans-unit.source: Enterprise applications also have the requirement for secure access, with employees and business partners connecting to data using secure identities under direct control of the enterprise.
trans-unit.target: Enterprise applications also have the requirement for secure access, with employees and business partners connecting to data using secure identities under direct control of the enterprise.

trans-unit.source: Enterprise applications running on Azure App Service (AAS) can provide all of these capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Enterprise applications running on Azure App Service (AAS) can provide all of these capabilities.

trans-unit.source: The example employee travel application shown below shows an enterprise multichannel application secured via Azure Active Directory (AAD) that integrates with both on-premises resources as well as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) services such as Office 365 and Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: The example employee travel application shown below shows an enterprise multichannel application secured via Azure Active Directory (AAD) that integrates with both on-premises resources as well as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) services such as Office 365 and Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: Controlling Access with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Controlling Access with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Users of the travel application must first authenticate against a corporate Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Users of the travel application must first authenticate against a corporate Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: A few steps were taken to configure the application to use Azure Active Directory (AAD):
trans-unit.target: A few steps were taken to configure the application to use Azure Active Directory (AAD):

trans-unit.source: An Azure Active Directory was created for the enterprise.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Active Directory was created for the enterprise.

trans-unit.source: The enterprise's on-premises Active Directory was federated with the Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The enterprise's on-premises Active Directory was federated with the Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Finally, the application was registered with AAD using the easy AAD integration feature of Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Finally, the application was registered with AAD using the easy AAD integration feature of Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: The end result is that the application prompts users to login against AAD (and by extension, the corporate AD).
trans-unit.target: The end result is that the application prompts users to login against AAD (and by extension, the corporate AD).

trans-unit.source: AAD Login
trans-unit.target: AAD Login

trans-unit.source: For more information on setting up AAS integration with AAD, see
trans-unit.target: For more information on setting up AAS integration with AAD, see

trans-unit.source: AAS Integration with AAD
trans-unit.target: AAS Integration with AAD

trans-unit.source: Accessing On-premises Resources
trans-unit.target: Accessing On-premises Resources

trans-unit.source: Once a user is logged in against AAD, they see a list of planned corporate travel.
trans-unit.target: Once a user is logged in against AAD, they see a list of planned corporate travel.

trans-unit.source: Since the web application is running in Microsoft Azure, it needs a way to access the on-premises SQL Server which contains this information.
trans-unit.target: Since the web application is running in Microsoft Azure, it needs a way to access the on-premises SQL Server which contains this information.

trans-unit.source: Data from On-premises Sql Server
trans-unit.target: Data from On-premises Sql Server

trans-unit.source: The application is configured with the point-to-site VNET integration feature.
trans-unit.target: The application is configured with the point-to-site VNET integration feature.

trans-unit.source: This enables the application to use standard data access logic (in this case Entity Framework) to transparently access a remote SQL Server running inside of the corporation's network.
trans-unit.target: This enables the application to use standard data access logic (in this case Entity Framework) to transparently access a remote SQL Server running inside of the corporation's network.

trans-unit.source: For more information on point-to-site VNET integration, see
trans-unit.target: For more information on point-to-site VNET integration, see

trans-unit.source: VNET Integration
trans-unit.target: VNET Integration

trans-unit.source: Integration with Office 365
trans-unit.target: Integration with Office 365

trans-unit.source: Each time an employee creates a travel record, the web application creates a travel request in a SharePoint Online list.
trans-unit.target: Each time an employee creates a travel record, the web application creates a travel request in a SharePoint Online list.

trans-unit.source: There is a link in the application that employees can use to easily access the Sharepoint list:
trans-unit.target: There is a link in the application that employees can use to easily access the Sharepoint list:

trans-unit.source: SharePoint List Link
trans-unit.target: SharePoint List Link

trans-unit.source: Clicking the link will automatically navigate to the SharePoint list.
trans-unit.target: Clicking the link will automatically navigate to the SharePoint list.

trans-unit.source: Because employees are logged in against their corporate AAD, they are transparently authenticated against Office 365 using the security token issued by AAD.
trans-unit.target: Because employees are logged in against their corporate AAD, they are transparently authenticated against Office 365 using the security token issued by AAD.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint List
trans-unit.target: SharePoint List

trans-unit.source: The web application also creates a travel document in a Sharepoint Online document library.
trans-unit.target: The web application also creates a travel document in a Sharepoint Online document library.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Document Library
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Document Library

trans-unit.source: The assets created in SharePoint Online allow the web application to leverage capabilities in Office 365.
trans-unit.target: The assets created in SharePoint Online allow the web application to leverage capabilities in Office 365.

trans-unit.source: For example a decision/approval workflow could be triggered each time an item is created in the Sharepoint list.
trans-unit.target: For example a decision/approval workflow could be triggered each time an item is created in the Sharepoint list.

trans-unit.source: For more information on Office 365 integration, see
trans-unit.target: For more information on Office 365 integration, see

trans-unit.source: Office 365 Integration
trans-unit.target: Office 365 Integration

trans-unit.source: Integration with SaaS Services
trans-unit.target: Integration with SaaS Services

trans-unit.source: Companies today use a variety of SaaS services, and need to interact with SaaS data from other applications.
trans-unit.target: Companies today use a variety of SaaS services, and need to interact with SaaS data from other applications.

trans-unit.source: The travel application shows one example of this scenario.
trans-unit.target: The travel application shows one example of this scenario.

trans-unit.source: It updates customer account information in Salesforce each time an employee plans travel to a customer account.
trans-unit.target: It updates customer account information in Salesforce each time an employee plans travel to a customer account.

trans-unit.source: Salesforce Integration
trans-unit.target: Salesforce Integration

trans-unit.source: The corporation's Salesforce account is set up with AAD to allow transparent authentication against Salesforce using AAD credentials.
trans-unit.target: The corporation's Salesforce account is set up with AAD to allow transparent authentication against Salesforce using AAD credentials.

trans-unit.source: As a result, once employees are logged into the travel application using AAD, the application can read and write data stored in Salesforce.
trans-unit.target: As a result, once employees are logged into the travel application using AAD, the application can read and write data stored in Salesforce.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SaaS integration, see
trans-unit.target: For more information on SaaS integration, see

trans-unit.source: SaaS Integration
trans-unit.target: SaaS Integration

trans-unit.target: Next Steps
